dialog.text: Why does the shadow feel like an enemy? Every time I look, it snarls and I push away.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: vulnerable, unsure. Intonation: rising at the end. Speed: slow. Tone: small, breathy.

dialog.text: Because you've learned to punish what frightens you. I am not your enemy—I am the part that carried what you couldn't yet carry.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: warm, steady. Intonation: calm and grounding. Speed: measured. Tone: compassionate.

dialog.text: A part that carried pain? It only ever shouts, points fingers, reminds me of mistakes. How do I stop running from it?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: anxious, pleading. Intonation: questioning. Speed: moderate. Tone: soft urgency.

dialog.text: Begin with one breath. Place your hand on your heart. When the old alarm rings, name the feeling out loud—'fear', 'shame', 'lonely'—without blame.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: gentle instructor. Intonation: slow, rhythmic. Speed: slow. Tone: reassuring, step-by-step.

dialog.text: Won't naming it make it louder? I'm scared that calling it out will make it stronger.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: doubtful, tentative. Intonation: quiet, small. Speed: slow. Tone: worried whisper.

dialog.text: Names are lights in dark rooms. When you say 'shame' you stop feeding the mystery; you see its shape. Seeing lets you choose how to hold it.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: calm certainty. Intonation: gentle clarity. Speed: measured. Tone: warm and steady.

dialog.text: Okay… I'll try. What if it speaks back and I don't like what it says?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: brave, trembling. Intonation: hesitant but willing. Speed: moderate. Tone: hopeful.

dialog.text: Listen first. Ask, 'What do you need?' and wait. Don't fix, don't justify. Listening is the first heal—tender attention proves you're safe to be known.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: patient, invitational. Intonation: soft, encouraging. Speed: slow. Tone: intimate, steady.

dialog.text: It says it's tired of hiding, tired of making me small. It says it wanted to protect me and instead taught me to hide.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: surprised, relieved. Intonation: amazed, quiet. Speed: moderate. Tone: softer, accepting.

dialog.text: Thank it. Tell it you hear it, that you will not exile it anymore. A simple promise—'I will meet you'—builds a bridge between shame and love.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: encouraging, tender. Intonation: calm imperative. Speed: measured. Tone: soothing.

dialog.text: I promise. Saying it out loud feels like the knot inside me loosening—like remembering something warm I forgot.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: relieved, soft awe. Intonation: gentle release. Speed: slow. Tone: intimate and warm.

dialog.text: This is the inner adventure Joseph Campbell named—the hero's journey inside you. Each time you choose to see rather than flee, you come home a little more.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: inspired, calm. Intonation: rising with hope. Speed: measured. Tone: wise and uplifting.

dialog.text: I will keep coming back to the mirror. I will listen, name, and promise again. I can feel the weight shifting.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: determined, peaceful. Intonation: steady, resolved. Speed: moderate. Tone: warm confidence.

dialog.text: Start tonight with one honest look. Ask yourself: which part of me am I ready to meet? Share one small truth in the comments—one step. Let's hold this work together.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral. Emotional range: inviting, calm. Intonation: soft invitation. Speed: moderate. Tone: encouraging call to action.
